Package com.example.lotteryevent.viewmodels

Class EventDetailsViewModel

java.lang.Object
androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
com.example.lotteryevent.viewmodels.EventDetailsViewModel
public class EventDetailsViewModel extends androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
ViewModel for the EventDetailsFragment. This class is responsible for the business logic of determining what UI to show based on the event's state and the user's status. It combines data streams from the repository into a single, simple UI state that the Fragment can observe.

      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • loadEventDetails

      public void loadEventDetails(String eventId)
      The entry point for the Fragment to start loading data.
      Parameters:
      eventId - event's ID to load for

    • onPositiveButtonClicked

      Join waiting list/accept invite/leave waiting list Request for location if joining waitlist

    • onNegativeButtonClicked

      public void onNegativeButtonClicked()
      Declines invitation if action is that

    • getIsAdmin

      public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<Boolean> getIsAdmin()
      Exposes the administrative status of the current user. The Fragment can observe this to determine if admin-only controls (like delete) should be visible.
      Returns:
      A LiveData Boolean that is true if the user is an admin, false otherwise.

    • checkAdminStatus

      public void checkAdminStatus()
      Checks the current user's authentication status and queries the repository to see if they have admin privileges. This should be called when the Fragment view is created to update the getIsAdmin() LiveData.

    • deleteEvent

      public void deleteEvent(String eventId)
      Requests the deletion of a specific event through the repository. This action is generally restricted to users with administrative privileges.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique ID of the event to be deleted.

    • getIsDeleted

      public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<Boolean> getIsDeleted()
      Exposes a status flag indicating whether the event has been successfully deleted. The Fragment can observe this to trigger navigation away from the screen (e.g., popping the back stack).
      Returns:
      A LiveData Boolean that becomes true when the deletion operation completes successfully.

    • deleteOrganizer

      public void deleteOrganizer(String organizerId)
      Requests the deletion of a specific organizer through the repository. This action is generally restricted to users with administrative privileges.
      Parameters:
      organizerId - The unique ID of the organizer to be deleted.

    • getIsOrganizerDeleted

      public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<Boolean> getIsOrganizerDeleted()
      Exposes a status flag indicating whether the organizer has been successfully deleted. The Fragment can observe this to trigger navigation away from the screen (e.g., popping the back stack).
      Returns:
      A LiveData Boolean that becomes true when the deletion operation completes successfully.

    • onLocationRetrieved

      public void onLocationRetrieved(double latitude, double longitude)
      Called by the Fragment after it successfully retrieves the location.
      Parameters:
      latitude - latitude coord
      longitude - longitude coord

    • onLocationPermissionDenied

      public void onLocationPermissionDenied()
      Called by the Fragment if the user denied permission.

    • notifyEntrant

      public void notifyEntrant(String userId, String organizerMessage, NotificationCustomManager manager)
      Sends a notification message to all entrants in the provided list. Iterates through each entrant and delegates the notification sending to the repository. Only valid entrants with non-null user IDs are processed.
      Parameters:
      organizerMessage - the message content written by the event organizer

    • getWaitingListCount

      public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<Integer> getWaitingListCount()
      This function exposes the waiting list count to the Fragment.
      Returns:
      a LiveData representing the waiting list count

    • getUserProfile

      public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<User> getUserProfile()
      Exposes the user profile data as an observable LiveData object.

      The UI should observe this field to receive updates when a user's profile is successfully loaded.

      Returns:
      A LiveData object containing the User profile.

    • getErrorState

      public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<String> getErrorState()
      Exposes error messages related to user profile operations.

      The UI should observe this field to display error notifications (e.g., Toasts) if data loading fails.

      Returns:
      A LiveData object containing the error message string.

    • loadUserProfile

      public void loadUserProfile(String userId)
      Initiates an asynchronous request to fetch detailed profile information for a specific user.

      This method delegates the data fetching to the IAdminUserProfileRepository. Upon success, the getUserProfile() LiveData is updated. Upon failure, the getErrorState() LiveData is updated with the exception message.

      Parameters:
      userId - The unique identifier of the user to load.
